alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Cherry and northern Sheridan Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 820 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near White Clay, or 8 miles southeast of Pine Ridge, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, White Clay, Clinton, Pine Ridge, Hoover Lake, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road and Mount Maria. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 97 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of and north central Nebraska.
